analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra banda nam ka ro mi zhes phyag bya'o //

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs nas /

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ratna banda nam ka ro mi /
translated: say Oṃ sarvatathāgata ratna-bandhanakarohi,

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs su /

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs su /
translated: And likewise in the north,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ka rma banda nam ka ro mi //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ka rma banda nam ka ro mi //
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata karmabhyaṇdanaṃ karo mi.

original: zhes bya bas phyag bzhi byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas phyag bzhi byas la /
translated: Thus, one should make four prostrations.

original: g-yas pa'i khu tshur spyi bor bzhag nas /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i khu tshur spyi bor bzhag nas /
translated: Placing the right fist on the crown of one’s head,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta audbha ba ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta audbha ba ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata udghāvaṃ sayaṃ svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas lus dang ngag dang sems byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas lus dang ngag dang sems byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should consecrate body, speech, and mind.

original: khu tshur de nyid kyis kha la /
analyzed: khu tshur de nyid kyis kha la /
translated: With that very fist, at the mouth,

original: aom padmod bha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom padmod bha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ padmodbha vāya svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas ngag byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ngag byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should consecrate speech.

original: g-yon pa'i khu tshur snying gar bzhag nas /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i khu tshur snying gar bzhag nas /
translated: Placing the left fist on the heart,

original: aom badzrod bha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzrod bha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajrodbha vāya svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas sems byin gyis brlab bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sems byin gyis brlab bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should consecrate the mind.

original: de'i rjes la chog 'dis bgegs bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la chog 'dis bgegs bsal bar bya ste /
translated: After that, one should remove obstructors with this rite:

original: aom aa mri ta ha na ha na sarba bi ghn'am da ha da ha /
analyzed: aom aa mri ta ha na ha na sarba bi ghn'am da ha da ha /
translated: Oṃ amṛta hana hana sarva vighaṃ daha daha

original: sarba p'a pam h'um phat /
analyzed: sarba p'a pam h'um phat /
translated: sarva pāpaṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces bya ba brjod la thal mo sbyar nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba brjod la thal mo sbyar nas /
translated: Reciting that, one should join the palms together,

original: mthe bong bar du bzhag pa de la badzra h'um phat ces bya ba'i yi ge 'bar pa'i rnam par bkod la /
analyzed: mthe bong bar du bzhag pa de la badzra h'um phat ces bya ba'i yi ge 'bar pa'i rnam par bkod la /
translated: Place the thumbs in between, and arrange the syllables of vajra hūṃ phaṭ in the aspect of flames.

original: thal mo de las phyogs bcur 'bar ba'i rdo rje 'phro bar bsams nas /
analyzed: thal mo de las phyogs bcur 'bar ba'i rdo rje 'phro bar bsams nas /
translated: Think that from that palm, vajras blazing in the ten directions radiate.

original: aom aa mri ta ha na han sarba bighn'ana da ha da ha /
analyzed: aom aa mri ta ha na han sarba bighn'ana da ha da ha /
translated: Om amṛta hana hana sarva vighanān dāha dāha

original: sarba p'a pam h'um phat /
analyzed: sarba p'a pam h'um phat /
translated: sarva pāpaṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: ces bya ba 'di lan bdun brjod la thal mo lan gsum brdabs nas se gol yang lan gsum brdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di lan bdun brjod la thal mo lan gsum brdabs nas se gol yang lan gsum brdab par bya'o //
translated: Recite this seven times, clap the palms three times, and snap the fingers three times.

original: de'i rjes la sngar bshad pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje las rdo rje dra bas bgegs thams cad bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sngar bshad pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje las rdo rje dra bas bgegs thams cad bsal bar bya'o //
translated: After that, from the blazing vajra as previously explained, imagine that a vajra net repels all obstructors.

original: de'i rjes la rang gi snying gar aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rang gi snying gar aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: After that, in one’s heart center, from aṃ, there is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du re pha las me 'bar ba'i rnam pa bsams la /
analyzed: de'i steng du re pha las me 'bar ba'i rnam pa bsams la /
translated: Upon that, imagine the form of a blazing fire from re.

original: rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings nas /
analyzed: rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings nas /
translated: Form the vajra fist

original: rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rje btsun gyi yi ge brgya pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: and recite the one hundred syllables of the venerable master.

original: @192b aom padma satva sa ma ya /🔽ma nu p'a la ya /
analyzed: @192b aom padma satva sa ma ya /🔽ma nu p'a la ya /
translated: Om padmasatva samayam anupālaya🔽vajra satva samayam anupālaya

original: padma satva tve no pa tishtha /🔽dri dho me bha ba /🔽su to shyo me bha wa /
analyzed: padma satva tve no pa tishtha / dri dho me bha ba / su to shyo me bha wa /
translated: Be steady!🔽Be well!🔽Be without disease!

original: aa nu rakto me bha wa /🔽su po shyo me bha wa /🔽sarba siddhi me pra yatstsha /🔽sarba karma su tsame /
analyzed: aa nu rakto me bha wa / su po shyo me bha wa / sarba siddhi me pra yatstsha / sarba karma su tsame /
translated: Be well-disposed!🔽Grant all accomplishments!🔽Accomplish all deeds!

original: tsittam shre ya:ku ru h'um /
analyzed: tsittam shre ya:ku ru h'um /
translated: Make the mind joyful, HŪM!

original: ha ha ha ha ho:/
analyzed: ha ha ha ha ho:/
translated: HA HA HA HA HO!

original: bhag b'an sarba ta th'a ga ta padma m'a me munytsa padma badzri bta ba ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: zhes lan bdun brjod do //
analyzed: bhag b'an sarba ta th'a ga ta padma m'a me munytsa padma badzri bta ba ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: zhes lan bdun brjod do //
translated: Blessed One, all Tathāgatas, do not abandon me, the lotus, the vajra, the great pledge, be true!

original: spyi bor aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor cha bcu drug pa bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid la yi ge aom gyis brlabs la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi bor aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor cha bcu drug pa bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid la yi ge aom gyis brlabs la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On the crown, from A, a sixteen-spoked moon maṇḍala, the nature of nectar, is empowered by the syllable OṂ and should be meditated upon.

original: sngags brjod pa'i rjes nyid la snying ga'i gnas su re pha las me sbar la lus thams cad bsregs la yang spyi bo'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi 'bab par bsam mo //
analyzed: sngags brjod pa'i rjes nyid la snying ga'i gnas su re pha las me sbar la lus thams cad bsregs la yang spyi bo'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi 'bab par bsam mo //
translated: Immediately after reciting the mantra, fire is ignited from RE PHAṬ at the location of the heart. The entire body is burned and the nectar of the moon at the crown is imagined to descend.

original: de'i rjes la rdo rje thal mo bcings la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rdo rje thal mo bcings la /
translated: After that, form the vajra-folded-hand añjali:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dzo pastha n'a ya a'atma nam nirya ta y'a mi /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa sha ma se ta sarba satva nam sarba siddha ya sam paryan tam /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dzo pastha n'a ya a'atma nam nirya ta y'a mi / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa sha ma se ta sarba satva nam sarba siddha ya sam paryan tam /
translated: Oṃ, for the sake of offering to all tathāgatas, I will generate the mind of enlightenment.🔽Oṃ, for the sake of all beings, I will accomplish all that is to be accomplished by all tathāgatas.

original: sarba ta th'a ga tashtsa aa dhi tishtha tvam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga tashtsa aa dhi tishtha tvam /
translated: All tathāgatas, please empower me.

original: zhes bya ba 'di nyid lan gsum brjod la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nyid lan gsum brjod la /
translated: Recite this very verse three times.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nam mkha' yongs su gang bar lhag par mos la de rnams yid kyis mchod nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nam mkha' yongs su gang bar lhag par mos la de rnams yid kyis mchod nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Contemplate that the sky is completely filled with buddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas, and mentally make offerings to them. Then go for refuge and so forth.

original: aom dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: aom dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su mchi //
translated: Oṃ, I go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags //
translated: I confess each and every nonvirtue.

original: 'gro ba'i bsod nams rjes yi rang //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsod nams rjes yi rang //
translated: I rejoice in the merit of beings.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //
translated: I hold the mind of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya bas sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should confess sins, rejoice in merit, generate the mind of enlightenment, and so forth.

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /
translated: After that,🔽one should recite:

original: aom sva dh'a ba shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shuddhonya\ham /🔽zhes brjod la /
analyzed: aom sva dh'a ba shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shuddhonya\ham / zhes brjod la /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.

original: byang chub kyi sems tsam la lhag par gnas pa sems kyis mthong nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems tsam la lhag par gnas pa sems kyis mthong nas /
translated: Having seen that one remains in the mere mind of enlightenment,🔽one should recite:

original: aom dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a pa a'atma konya\ham /🔽zhes mngon par brjod nas /
analyzed: aom dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a pa a'atma konya\ham / zhes mngon par brjod nas /
translated: Oṃ dharmadhātu svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: byang chub kyi sems de yi ge pam gyi rnam par yongs su gyur par mthong nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yi ge pam gyi rnam par yongs su gyur par mthong nas /
translated: Having seen that the mind of enlightenment transforms into the form of the syllable paṃ,

original: de nas sna tshogs padma chen por bskyed la /🔽de'i steng du yi ge aa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de nas sna tshogs padma chen por bskyed la / de'i steng du yi ge aa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: then one should generate a great variegated lotus.🔽On that, from the syllable aṃ, is a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du yang yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /🔽de'i steng du bhr'um dkar po /
analyzed: de'i steng du yang yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor / de'i steng du bhr'um dkar po /
translated: On that, from the syllable aṃ, is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de las mchod rten dkar po /
analyzed: de las mchod rten dkar po /
translated: On that, from a white bhrūṃ, is a white stūpa.

original: de las yang /
analyzed: de las yang /
translated: From that, again,

original: rnam pa gsum du spros pa nyid kyis bum pa dang / kha khyar thams cad kyi steng du yang yi ge h'um bsams la /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du spros pa nyid kyis bum pa dang / kha khyar thams cad kyi steng du yang yi ge h'um bsams la /
translated: By the mere proliferation of the three aspects, one should imagine the syllable hūṃ above all the vases and the water-pots.

original: bum pa de'i nang du yang aa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /🔽de'i @193a * //
analyzed: bum pa de'i nang du yang aa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor / de'i @193a * //
translated: In the interior of the vase, one should imagine an āḥ syllable, from which arises a sun maṇḍala.

original: steng du yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: steng du yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: Upon that, one should imagine a moon maṇḍala arisen from an āḥ syllable.

original: de la yi ge drug las 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma dmar po /
analyzed: de la yi ge drug las 'dab ma brgyad pa'i padma dmar po /
translated: Upon that, one should imagine an eight-petaled lotus arisen from the six syllables, red,

original: mtshams kyi 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: mtshams kyi 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa /
translated: with twelve petals in the intermediate directions.

original: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i:las 'dab ma drug pa'i padma dkar po //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i:las 'dab ma drug pa'i padma dkar po //
translated: Upon that, one should imagine a six-petaled white lotus arisen from the syllable hriḥ.

original: de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /🔽de'i steng du aom ma ni padme h'um /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor / de'i steng du aom ma ni padme h'um /
translated: Upon that, one should imagine a moon maṇḍala arisen from an āḥ syllable.

original: zhes bya ba yi ge drug pa gong nas gong du nang du zhugs par rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yi ge drug pa gong nas gong du nang du zhugs par rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Upon that, one should imagine the six syllables oṃ maṇi padme hūṃ, one above the other, entering into each other.

original: de gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug zhal gcig pa phyag drug pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi dbu rgyan can bsgom mo //
analyzed: de gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug zhal gcig pa phyag drug pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi dbu rgyan can bsgom mo //
translated: From their transformation, one should imagine the Blessed One, white in color, the noble Avalokiteśvara with one face and six arms, crowned with Amitābha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag g-yas pa'i dang po ni ba dan gsum pa'i phyag rgya de'i rtse mo la cung zad dbu 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag g-yas pa'i dang po ni ba dan gsum pa'i phyag rgya de'i rtse mo la cung zad dbu 'dud pa'o //
translated: The first right hand of the Blessed One is in the gesture of the three banners, the tips of which are slightly bent.

original: gnyis pa la phreng ba /
analyzed: gnyis pa la phreng ba /
translated: The second holds a garland.

original: gsum pa'i phyag skyabs sbyin la rin po che zur drug pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i phyag skyabs sbyin la rin po che zur drug pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: The third hand is in the gesture of granting fearlessness and holds a six-faceted jewel.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang pos padma'i steng du rin po che zur drug pa gnas pa la padma 'dab ma drug pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang pos padma'i steng du rin po che zur drug pa gnas pa la padma 'dab ma drug pa'o //
translated: The first left hand rests on a lotus and holds a six-faceted jewel, on top of which is a lotus with six petals.

original: gnyis pa la dbyug pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa la dbyug pa /
translated: The second holds a club.

original: gsum pa la ri la ba spyi blugs bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ri la ba spyi blugs bsnams pa'o //
translated: The third holds a water-pot.

original: de'i g-yon gyi padma la bcom ldan 'das padma sgrol ma aom padma t'a ri h'um zhes bya ba 'dis de'i rnam bar bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i g-yon gyi padma la bcom ldan 'das padma sgrol ma aom padma t'a ri h'um zhes bya ba 'dis de'i rnam bar bsam mo //
translated: On the lotus to his left is the Blessed One, Padmottara, who is visualized with the mantra Oṃ padmottari hūṃ.

original: khyad par ni padma dor la autpa la'i steng du rin po che zur drug pa'i steng du padma 'dab ma drug pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni padma dor la autpa la'i steng du rin po che zur drug pa'i steng du padma 'dab ma drug pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: The difference is that she holds a lotus and on top of a blue lotus is a six-faceted jewel on top of which is a lotus with six petals.

original: shar du aom badzra padma h'um /🔽lhor aom ratna padma h'um /
analyzed: shar du aom badzra padma h'um / lhor aom ratna padma h'um /
translated: In the east is Oṃ vajra padma hūṃ.🔽In the south is Oṃ ratna padma hūṃ.

original: nub tu aom mu ne padma h'um /
analyzed: nub tu aom mu ne padma h'um /
translated: In the west is Oṃ mune padma hūṃ.

original: byang du aom karma padma h'um /
analyzed: byang du aom karma padma h'um /
translated: In the north, “Om karma padma hum.”

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi rim pa 'dis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi rim pa 'dis /
translated: By this sequence of mantras,

original: rdo rje padma dang / rin chen padma dang / thub pa'i padma dang / las kyi padma rnams bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: rdo rje padma dang / rin chen padma dang / thub pa'i padma dang / las kyi padma rnams bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rnam par blta'o //
translated: one should see Vajra Padmanidhi, Ratna Padmanidhi, Muni Padmanidhi, and Karma Padmanidhi as the very nature of the Blessed One.

original: khyad par ni padma'i steng du rin po che zur drug pa'i steng du rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / 'khor lo dang / sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni padma'i steng du rin po che zur drug pa'i steng du rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / 'khor lo dang / sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: The difference is that on the lotus there is a six-cornered jewel, on which is a vajra, a jewel, a wheel, and a crossed vajra.

original: me'i phyogs su aom badzra t'a re h'um /
analyzed: me'i phyogs su aom badzra t'a re h'um /
translated: In the southeast, “Om vajra tara hum.”

original: bden bral gyi phyogs su aom ratna t'a re h'um /🔽rlung gi phyogs su aom mu ne t'a re h'um /
analyzed: bden bral gyi phyogs su aom ratna t'a re h'um / rlung gi phyogs su aom mu ne t'a re h'um /
translated: In the southwest, “Om ratna tara hum.”🔽In the northwest, “Om padma tara hum.”

original: dbang ldan du aom karma t'a re h'um /
analyzed: dbang ldan du aom karma t'a re h'um /
translated: In the northeast, “Om karma tara hum.”

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis go rims bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rnam par rdo rje sgrol ma dang / rin chen sgrol ma dang / thub pa'i sgrol ma dang / las kyi sgrol ma dag bcom ldan 'das la mngon du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis go rims bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rnam par rdo rje sgrol ma dang / rin chen sgrol ma dang / thub pa'i sgrol ma dang / las kyi sgrol ma dag bcom ldan 'das la mngon du bltas pa'o //
translated: With this mantra, the Blessed One himself, in order, is Vajra Tara, Ratna Tara, Muni Tara, and Karma Tara, facing the Blessed One.

original: khyad par ni autpa la'i steng bzhin du /
analyzed: khyad par ni autpa la'i steng bzhin du /
translated: The difference is that, like on the utpala,

original: rin po che zur drug pa'i gnas su rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / 'khor @193b lo dang / sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rin po che zur drug pa'i gnas su rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / 'khor @193b lo dang / sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: in the place of the six-sided jewel, there is a vajra, a jewel, a wheel, and a crossed vajra.

original: brgyad po 'di dag sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine these eight, in the bodhisattva cross-legged posture, on moon discs.

original: phyogs mtshams kyi 'dab ma la shar phyogs su aom ya m'anta ka h'um /🔽lho ru aom pradzny'an ta ka h'um /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams kyi 'dab ma la shar phyogs su aom ya m'anta ka h'um / lho ru aom pradzny'an ta ka h'um /
translated: On the petals in the cardinal and intermediate directions, in the east is OM YAMANTAKA HUM.🔽In the south is OM PRAJNYANTAKA HUM.

original: nub tu aom padm'anta ka h'um /
analyzed: nub tu aom padm'anta ka h'um /
translated: In the west is OM PADMANTAKA HUM.

original: byang du aom bighn'anta ka h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ngo bor khro bo bzhi blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang du aom bighn'anta ka h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ngo bor khro bo bzhi blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the north, one should visualize the four wrathful ones as the nature of the Bhagavat himself with the mantra OṂ VIGHNAÑTAKA HŪṂ.

original: khyad par ni g-yas brkyang ba /
analyzed: khyad par ni g-yas brkyang ba /
translated: The difference is that they are standing with the right leg extended,

original: mi'u thung gi rnam pa la zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi'u thung gi rnam pa la zhal rnam par 'gyur ba /
translated: with the form of a dwarf, with a contorted face,

original: sna gong nyag pa smin ma ser skya nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sna gong nyag pa smin ma ser skya nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa /
translated: with a hooked nose, with yellow eyebrows, standing on a sun disc,

original: 'od 'bar ba'i dbus su gnas par bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'od 'bar ba'i dbus su gnas par bsgom mo //
translated: meditating in the middle of a blazing light.

original: thams cad kyi g-yon pa'i rtsa ba'i phyag dag ni sdigs mdzub mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi g-yon pa'i rtsa ba'i phyag dag ni sdigs mdzub mdzad pa'o //
translated: All of them have threatening forefingers in their left root hands.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag dag la tho ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag dag la tho ba'o //
translated: In the right hands they have hammers.

original: gnyis pa la ral gri'o /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ral gri'o /
translated: In the second they have swords.

original: gsum pa la zhags pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la zhags pa'o //
translated: In the third they have lassos.

original: lhag ma'i phyag gnyis la padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i phyag gnyis la padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: In the remaining two hands they have lotuses and crossed vajras.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bskyed la snying gar bam las padma dkar po /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bskyed la snying gar bam las padma dkar po /
translated: Thus, having generated the maṇḍala wheel, in the heart one should visualize a white lotus from BHAṂ.

original: de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du aom ma ni padme h'um zhes snga ma bzhin du yi ge rnams bsams la /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du aom ma ni padme h'um zhes snga ma bzhin du yi ge rnams bsams la /
translated: On top of that, from A arises a moon mandala. On top of that, one should imagine the syllables as before, Om mani padme hum.

original: de las 'od zer spros nas sems can thams cad yang dag par sbyangs nas /
analyzed: de las 'od zer spros nas sems can thams cad yang dag par sbyangs nas /
translated: Light rays emanate from that, and having purified all sentient beings,

original: bcom ldan 'das gyi ngo bor  bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gyi ngo bor  bsgrubs nas /
translated: they are established in the nature of the Bhagavat.

original: yang bsdus te de nyid du zhugs so //
analyzed: yang bsdus te de nyid du zhugs so //
translated: Again, they are gathered and enter into that.

original: de'i rjes la sngags kha nas byung nas rdo rje'i lam nas rjes su zhugs nas mu tig gi phreng ba ltar bsams nas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sngags kha nas byung nas rdo rje'i lam nas rjes su zhugs nas mu tig gi phreng ba ltar bsams nas bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: After that, the mantra comes out of the mouth, enters through the path of the vajra, and is imagined like a string of pearls. One should recite.

original: bzlas pa byas nas snying ga'i sngags las cig car dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo phyi rol du spros nas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa byas nas snying ga'i sngags las cig car dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo phyi rol du spros nas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Having recited, one should emanate the wheel of the mandala all at once from the mantra in the heart and make offerings.

original: 'di dag gi sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gi sngags ni /
translated: The mantras for these are:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aargham p'u dza ma gha sa mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aargham p'u dza ma gha sa mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Om sarva tathagata argham pûja megha samudra spharana samaye hum.

original: aargham gyi sngags so //
analyzed: aargham gyi sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for the argha.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra pushpa p'u dza me ghas mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra pushpa p'u dza me ghas mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata vajra puṣpa pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: me tog gi sngags so //
analyzed: me tog gi sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of flowers.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ratna p'u ja me ghas mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta ratna p'u ja me ghas mu dra sphar na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata ratna pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: mar me'i sngags so //
analyzed: mar me'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of lamps.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta gandha p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na byu ha h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta gandha p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na byu ha h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata gandha pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: byug pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: byug pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of perfume.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta r'a sa ae gro bi ta ni aa ha ri na santa ra pa ya me p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta r'a sa ae gro bi ta ni aa ha ri na santa ra pa ya me p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata rāsa egravitāni aharaṇa santāraya pāya me pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: lha bshos gyi sngags so //
analyzed: lha bshos gyi sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of incense.

original: de ltar mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Having made offerings in this way,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rang gi snying ga'i sngags kyi yi ge la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rang gi snying ga'i sngags kyi yi ge la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should cause the wheel of the maṇḍala to enter the mantra letters in one’s heart.

original: de'i rjes @194a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes @194a * //
translated: After that,

original: la bstod pa dang / smon lam yang btab nas /
analyzed: la bstod pa dang / smon lam yang btab nas /
translated: having praised and made aspirations,

original: langs la rang gi lha'i nga rgyal gyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: langs la rang gi lha'i nga rgyal gyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: one should rise and abide with the pride of one’s deity.

original: yi ge drug pa'i rgyud kyi rim pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: yi ge drug pa'i rgyud kyi rim pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bstan pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana teaching the maṇḍala wheel by the stages of the Tantra of the Six Syllables is complete.
